Tang, who was born to college professor parents in Shanghai, moved to California in 1982, with $20 in hand, to follow his girlfriend (now his wife) when he was 18.
After he graduated, he said he applied for 57 engineering jobs and was roundly rejected (he chalks it up to youthful arrogance).
He studied electrical engineering at Cal Poly Pomona, paying his way through school by working restaurant jobs.
